intro: Triglochin andina, commonly known as the Andean spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and shallow water areas. Its stems are often reddish or purple and bear small, inconspicuous flowers. Triglochin andina is adapted to tolerate fluctuating water levels and is often found in regions with high humidity.
